required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lipoprotein(a) in Patients With Cardiovascular Disease (CVD)
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-center Cross-sectional Epidemiological Study to Characterize the Prevalence and Distribution of Lipoprotein(a) Levels Among Patients With Established Cardiovascular Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The study is conducted to improve knowledge about the epidemiology of Lipoprotein(a) in patients with established cardiovascular disease (CVD).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This is a multi-center cross-sectional epidemiological study to estimate the prevalence (%) of patients with elevated Lp(a) in patients with established CVD defined by their medical history. One study visit is planned for data collection. Relevant medical history and laboratory values for LDL-cholesterol (LDL-C) and Lp(a) within a past pre-specified period will be collected retrospectively. In case laboratory data are not available, blood sampling will be performed.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patients with normal and elevated Lipoprotein(a) (Lp(a)) levels in patients with established Cardiovascular Disease (CVD)
primary_outcome.description: Prevalence of normal and elevated Lp(a) levels in patients with established CVD

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the median and other relevant statistics describing the distribution of Lp(a) within the normal range and elevated Lp(a) levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Lp(a) values by region and country
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the median and other relevant statistics describing the distribution of Lp(a) by region and country

secondary_outcome.measure: Low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL(C)) values (corrected and uncorrected)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the median and other relevant statistics describing the distribution of LDL-C (corrected and uncorrected) within the normal range and with elevated Lp(a) levels

intervention.other_name: In case retrospective laboratory data are not available, blood sampling will be performed to analyze Lp(a)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- Established CVD defined as one of the following:
- History of a myocardial infarction (MI) ≥3 months and ≤10 years before the study visit
- History of ischemic stroke ≥ 3 months and ≤ 10 years before the study visit
- Symptomatic PAD (intermitted claudication with ankle-brachial index ≤0.90 and/or lower limb amputation or re-vascularization due to lower limb ischemia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients currently enrolled in clinical studies with investigational drugs
